descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases experienced contributors by promoting members who have gained sufficient proficiency.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by advancing capable new contributors into this role.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by promoting the most experienced and committed contributors.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill development by providing direct guidance and tacit knowledge to newcomers.
Effective mentorship increases the promotion rate by preparing contributors more quickly for advanced roles.
More core developers increase mentorship capacity and implicit knowledge transfer within the community.
Good documentation accelerates the skill up process by providing accessible learning resources for newcomers.
A larger pool of potential contributors increases the new contributor stock through successful onboarding.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the skill up flow as more individuals undergo training.
A larger core developer group can increase turnover due to burnout or career progression outside the project.
More experienced contributors increase the promotion rate by providing a larger candidate pool for core roles.
